humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions on Jacques and Inscriptions indicate the time of the moonrise in a moon shape. " Moon " and " Xi " were originally expressed in the shape of a moon, and there is no difference between them. Later, due to the division of labor in different bodies, one point in the moon shape was used to represent " moon ", and no point in the moon shape to represent " evening ", which split into two different shapes of characters. (Qiu Xigui)

The original meaning of " Xi " is when the moon rises in the evening, which is different from the " night " between dark and dawn, but sometimes the usage of " Xi " can also refer to the dark night. "Said Wen": "Evening, Mo also. See you from the moon. All the genres of the evening are from the evening." " Mo " means " evening ", referring to the evening.

Oracle bone inscriptions use the original meaning, such as "Hebu" 3555: "Ding (Zhen): Rain today." "He Ji" 6647 is: "Ding (Zhen): Wang Xi is out." Jin Wen means night, and " chao " and "å¤™"Relatively, like Qin Gongzhong: "Yu Suxi respects me." "Suxi" means from morning to night.
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions on Jacques and Inscriptions indicate the time of the moonrise in the shape of a moon. The original meaning is when the moon rises in the evening.

["Guangyun" Xiangyi cuts, enters the past, evil. ]
(1) In the evening, at sunset.
(2) The west; the west; the west of the mountain.
(3) Said to be westward; westward.
(4) In ancient times, it means to meet the emperor in the evening.
(5) Refers to meeting the elder in the evening.
(6) Night.
(7) Refers to the end of the year or the end of January. Also refers to the end of each month.
(8) Refers to the ritual of ancient emperors to worship the moon. See "Xiyue".
(9) Oblique. See "Evening Room".
(10) Quantifiers.
(11) Last name. There is Xibin in the Three Kingdoms Shu. See "TongzhiÂ·Clan Five".
